structure.unit: Disclosure And Regulation Of Campaign Expenditures And Contributions

law.catch_line: Media Organization Offering Time And Space To Qualified Candidates At No Cost Or Reduced Price; Limitations

text.section: As used in this section the following words shall have the following meanings:—

A media organization may make time or space available to a qualified candidate at no cost or at reduced cost for the purpose of presentation of the candidate’s own political advertising; provided, however, that:—

time of the same duration and the same market value or the same amount of space and the same market value is made available to all other qualified candidates for the same office for the same election; and
the media corporation makes disclosure of its conduct under this section in conformance with rules and regulations promulgated by the director of the office of campaign and political finance.

A media organization acting in conformance with this section shall not be deemed to be in violation of section eight and shall not be deemed to be making a contribution within the meaning of this chapter.
